greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A000120(A245611(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
formula: a(1) = 0, a(2) = 1, for n > 2, a(n) = a(A285712(n)) + [n <> 2 mod 3]. (Where [] is Iverson bracket, giving here 1 if n is of the form 3k or 3k+1, and 0 if it is of the form 3k+2.)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 25 2017
